Author: scubapanda#2485
Content: I was thinking of ways to transfer/airdrop these balances to a new Sapling Pirate. Can one start a KMD Sapling chain with a public premine at the current height of the Pirate chain? Balances on the old chain could then be sent to one transfer/airdrop z-address and credited on the other chain by the premine account. The destination Sapling address could be in the message field of the sent transfer? All done in Pirate zk-SNARK way üòâ

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Could work, yes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: If we did that, could we consider dragging out the emission schedule?

Content: I would be happy with that.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: emission schedule doesn't make any sense IMO

Author: scubapanda#2485
Content: I agree.

Author: scubapanda#2485

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Based on the "sapling turnstile" zcash post, it seems to me like it may just be a consensus rule imposed by the ZEC devs to audit the chain

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Maybe we can just not include that rule? No idea how viable that is. I'm not that adept when it comes to zkSNARKs

Author: scubapanda#2485
Content: Me neither and I would think there would be a substantial risk for a fork.

Author: scubapanda#2485
Content: Reading the sapling turnstile post again feels bizarre. First you create this crypto with zero knowledge zk-SNARKS and the you ask everyone to unshield their coins. Have the devs, after all, lost their faith in the 'protocol'? "Zcash engineers have gone through great lengths to protect the network from any deviation in the expected ZEC in circulation. We recommend reading about Zcash‚Äôs public parameters to understand counterfeiting risks and mitigation techniques. Regardless of how low the probability might be, taking the extra step to detect counterfeit coins is a valuable reassurance."

Author: scubapanda#2485
Content: If this is really done to check for counterfeit coins should we consider zk-SNARKS Pirated already üòÉ
